data.title: Pierre Elliott Trudeau Foundation
data.text:
Members appoint Directors to the Board of Directors, approve changes to the by-laws and appoint the external auditor. The Foundation’s membership is limited to thirty Members. Six seats are reserved for Members appointed by the Minister of Innovation, Science and Economic Development Canada (“ISED”) and another three seats are reserved for liquidators of the succession of the late Right Honourable Pierre Elliott Trudeau.

John English

Chair of the Members

Thomas S. Axworthy

He has had a distinguished career in government, academia, and philanthropy, including as president and CEO of the Gordon Foundation.

Dennis M. Browne

Member of the Law Society of Newfoundland

Denise Chong

Straddling the worlds of writing and public policy, Denise Chong was a trailblazer for diversity and inclusiveness in the public service before raising Canada's social consciousness with acclaimed works of nonfiction.

John Fraser

President of the Institute for the Study of the Crown in Canada

Edward Johnson

Chair of the Board of the Foundation, he joined Power Corporation of Canada in Montreal as Secretary in 1985 and in 1987 became Senior Vice-President and General Counsel.

Frederick H. Lowy

Mr. Lowy has been the psychiatrist-in-chief and the director of the Clarke Institute of Psychiatry, and a professor at, and chair of, the University of Toronto's Department of Psychiatry. He has also been the 4th Rector and Vice-Chancellor of Concordia University.

Bruce McNiven

Founding Member, Vice-chair, and Treasurer at the Foundation

Mayo Moran

Provost and Vice-Chancellor, Trinity College

Robert Murdoch

A Member of the International Advisory Board of Lafarge S.A., he was President and CEO of Lafarge North America from 1987 to 1992.

Patrick Pichette

General Partner at iNovia Capital.

Duncan Reid

Duncan Reid is a lawyer in Vancouver, BC, and a partner at Farris, Vaughan, Wills & Murphy LLP. Born and raised in Vancouver, he lived and worked in London, Hong Kong and New York for Goldman Sachs International and for New York law firm Sullivan & Cromwell LLP before returning home to Vancouver with his family in 2012.

Sean E. Riley

President of St. Francis Xavier University and Chair of the Council of Nova Scotia University Presidents, he also served on the Board of the Canada Millennium Scholarship Foundation.

Roy J. Romanow

A Canadian politician and former Premier of Saskatchewan (1991–2001), he also headed the Royal Commission on the Future of Health Care in Canada.

Peter Sahlas

An Attorney and Counsellor at Law in the State of New York, he specializes in the resolution of complex international disputes involving public authorities in emerging markets.

Nancy Southam

A neighbour, travelling companion, and close friend of Pierre Elliott Trudeau Nancy Southam has been a member of the Foundation since 2014.

Stephen J. Toope

Professor Toope is vice-chancellor at the University of Cambridge. He has been the president of the Pierre Elliott Trudeau Foundation.

Alexandre Trudeau

Son of the late Right Honourable Pierre Elliott Trudeau, Alexandre Trudeau is a documentary filmmaker and freelance journalist.
